Description: Silver Key assists seniors who do not qualify for government food assistance in an emergency situation with donations of food and necessities from the community.
Address: 1605 S. Murray Blvd. Colorado Springs, CO 80916
Requirements: Must Request Referel

Description: These food boxes allow seniors to stretch their food dollars further by supplementing their diets with a variety of foods, such as: nonfat dry and ultra-high temperature fluid milk, juice, farina, oats, ready-to-eat cereal, rice, pasta, peanut butter, dry beans, canned meat or poultry or fish, and canned fruits and vegetables.
Requirements: Must be 60 years or older, Must apply in person, Must have documentation of Residence and Income

Description: These food supplies allow seniors to stretch their food dollars further by supplementing their diets with a variety of foods, such as: nonfat dry milk, rice, peanut butter, cereal, pasta, beans, canned fruits and vegetables, canned meat, dried fruit and a variety of other foods. These items vary and are on a “first come, first serve basis” until items run out.
Requirements: Must have identification, Must have proof of residence, Cannot be combined with any other community program

Description: The American Red Cross works in partnership with Military Aid Societies to provide quality, reliable financial assistance to eligible applicants 24/7/365. Assistance can include funds for emergency travel, burial of a loved one, emergency food and shelter, etc. The Aid Societies determine the financial assistance package that will be offered – a grant or a loan. The Red Cross is the mechanism to expedite access to these financial resources.
Hours: Avalible anytime online, through app, or through toll-free number
Requirements: Must be active or previous service member or immediate family member of the above

Description: For those who truly do not have enough food to last approximately three days, emergency food is available during this time.
CE provides timely access to appropriate housing programs through a centralized, equitable, person-centered process that preserves choice, dignity, and transparency.
Address: 121 South Tejon Street, Suite 601 Colorado Springs, CO 80903
Requirements: Must complete VI-SPDAT with provider

Description: The Independence Center supports access to housing through Colorado’s Division of Housing and Veterans Administration-funded housing voucher programs.  Through the training and resources that these vouchers offer, our Housing Coordinators can support you in your search for affordable, accessible housing, an essential component of independent living.
Address: 729 S. Tejon St., Colorado Springs, CO 80903
Requirements: Must be disabled or have a disabled loved one

Description: The Independence Center’s (The IC) Deaf & Hard of Hearing program is designed to enhance the lives of individuals with hearing loss, encouraging you to live the independent life you choose for yourself through a variety of means. This program also provides assistance with the following via Direct Communication:
Address: 729 S. Tejon St., Colorado Springs, CO 80903
Requirements: Must be deaf or hard of hearing

Description: Receive a reduced rate with Mountain Metro Transit with a Disability Picture ID Bus Card! The IC is the only issuing agency working with the City of Colorado Springs Transit Services for this card.
Address: 729 S. Tejon St., Colorado Springs, CO 80903
Requirements: Must bring state ID and proff of disability

Description: Navigating the health care system can be overwhelming. Medical Case Managers are trained to assist those living with HIV to understand how to best manage their healthcare! Our specialist team of HIV Medical Case Managers will partner with you to develop a comprehensive care plan that addresses your specific concerns.
Address: 1301 South 8th Street, Suite 200, Colorado Springs, CO 80905
Requirements: Must present proof of HIV diagnosis

Description: Navigating the health care system can be overwhelming. Medical Case Managers are trained to assist those living with HIV to understand how to best manage their healthcare! Our specialist team of HIV Medical Case Managers will partner with you to develop a comprehensive care plan that addresses your specific concerns.
Address: 807 N. Greenwood Street Suite 200 Pueblo, CO 81003
Requirements: Must present proof of HIV diagnosis

Description: It can be tough to manage a chronic health issue if you have difficulty getting to your appointments. CHN can help by providing transportation assistance for those living with HIV to get medical, mental health, dental and case management appointments
Address: 1301 South 8th Street, Suite 200, Colorado Springs, CO 80905
Requirements: Must present proof of HIV diagnosis

Description: CHN believes housing is health care! Access to safe, reliable housing is a significant predictor of long-term wellbeing for people living with HIV, which is why we offer a variety of housing-related supportive services designed to address your unique situation.
Address: 1301 South 8th Street, Suite 200, Colorado Springs, CO 80905
Requirements: Must present proof of HIV diagnosis

Description: Access to nourishing, enjoyable food is a critical component to sustaining overall health and well-being when living with HIV. Each of CHN’s regional offices is equipped to assist eligible clients in meeting your nutritional needs. The food banks in Denver, Fort Collins, Greeley, Colorado Springs, and Pueblo offer food items directly and CHN’s Grand Junction office is able to provide nutritional assistance through grocery vouchers for eligible clients.
Address: 1301 South 8th Street, Suite 200, Colorado Springs, CO 80905
Requirements: Must present proof of HIV diagnosis

Description: Empower Work is a non-profit that envisions a world where everyone can thrive at work. When work actually works for people, every individual’s economic and emotional well-being increases. And there is a ripple effect: communities, companies, the economy, and our democracy, thrive.
Hours: Avalible anytime through text or online
